channel.title: Light weight distro with certain features
channel.description: Hi, Due to vista being a computer hog, I am in dire need of linux once more. I need a light weight distro, with a few certain features: 1. 800 x 480 resolution support 2. Special keyboard support [I don't know if this is possible, but [url=http://images.google.com/images?ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8&sourceid=navclient&gfns=1&q=oqo+02&um=1&sa=N&tab=wi]this[/url] is my keyboard. 3. Not too much of a memory hog. 4. Tablet support 5. [If possible] touch scroller [seen in picture] support Sorry if this bugs you, but it's pretty necessary for me at the moment. Best picture I can get of the keyboard: [img]http://www.gadgetell.com/images/2007/03/dsc01615.JPG[/img]

item.title: Light weight distro with certain features
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:21, topic:198530”][quote author=kloplop321 link=topic=263196.msg2182155#msg2182155 date=1208044157]
kinda like how the MacBook Air has no CD drive… “made for the world of Wireless” or so they say…
[/quote]
I dislike the MacBook Air. It’s thin… so what?
It’s still normal sized And not even a tablet.[/quote]
Plus it weighs about the same as the macbook

Read full topic

item.title: Light weight distro with certain features
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:16, topic:198530”][quote author=cooper link=topic=263196.msg2180663#msg2180663 date=1207990042]
I would, if I had a USB CD/DVD drive
I’m too cheap to buy one, as well. I was thinking about installing it over my network but I’ve had bad experiences with that before.
[/quote]

If you want to play safe go and get a USB CD/DVD drive, Doing network installations can turn out bad.[/quote]
Yeah, I’m going to try and convince my parents to let me, or maybe see if best buy has one I can rent/use at their store or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Light weight distro with certain features
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

I just copied as much as I needed onto an external hard drive.
I was wondering, would this work?
I create a new partition and put the contents of the XUbuntu ISO there.
I create a blank partition to install to.
Would I need to install GRUB first or something?
Or if possible instead of the first partition maybe use a USB Hard drive?

Read full topic

item.title: Light weight distro with certain features
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

cooper:

2) Is there support for docx files in linux yet?

I don’t think OpenOffice has native support for them yet, but there are tools to convert docx to odt and back.

http://odf-converter.sourceforge.net/download.html#command-line
http://www.zamzar.com/

Read full topic

item.title: Light weight distro with certain features
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Okay, I will install Xubuntu, as I have heard that ubuntu works best on it. I am planning to back up all of the windows things and reformat the drive, but I have 2 more questions:

  1. Can I install Xubuntu without using a CD/DVD?
  2. Is there support for docx files in linux yet?
    Thank you all very much

Read full topic
item.source: Light weight distro with certain features

item.title: Light weight distro with certain features
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

yah xubuntu is really light weight on memory, and as I can tell that that computer normally had vista(from your description) so you should have a LOT of free memory on Xubuntu.

Read full topic

item.title: Light weight distro with certain features
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

What brand is the tablet PC? It depends on the hardware, really.

EDIT: My bad, didn’t see the link.

It looks like the hardware is all supported. Use any distro you want, they all support the same stuff.
Beware you will probably have to fiddle a bit, you won’t get a fully working system out of the box on strange hardware like that (as you don’t with Windows).

Read full topic
item.source: Light weight distro with certain features

item.title: Light weight distro with certain features
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Hi,
Due to vista being a computer hog, I am in dire need of linux once more. I need a light weight distro, with a few certain features:

  1. 800 x 480 resolution support
  2. Special keyboard support [I don’t know if this is possible, but [url=http://images.google.com/images?ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8&sourceid=navclient&gfns=1&q=oqo+02&um=1&sa=N&tab=wi]this[/url] is my keyboard.
  3. Not too much of a memory hog.
  4. Tablet support
  5. [If possible] touch scroller [seen in picture] support
    Sorry if this bugs you, but it’s pretty necessary for me at the moment.
    Best picture I can get of the keyboard:

Read full topic
